tool.name: PCA 2D
tool.description: Perform and plot a 2D Principal Components Analysis
tool.command: echo 'galaxy_params.json' && cat 'galaxy_params.json' && echo '' && python '$__tool_directory__/format_values.py' 'galaxy_params.json' 'cleaned_params.json' --bool-values add_label interactive_plots save_plots && echo 'cleaned_params.json' && cat 'cleaned_params.json' && echo '' && mosuite plot_pca_2d --json=cleaned_params.json

param.name: moo_input_rds
param.label: MOO input Rds
param.help: File path to read the input multiOmicDataSet object (MOO)

param.name: count_type
param.label: Count Type
param.help: The type of counts to use from the multiOmicDataSet counts slot

param.name: sub_count_type
param.label: Sub Count Type
param.help: Used if count_type is a list in the counts slot: specify the sub count type within the list (optional)

param.name: principal_components
param.label: Principal Components
param.help: vector with numbered principal components to plot

param.name: feature_id_colname
param.label: FeatureID Name Column
param.help: The column from the counts dataa containing the Feature IDs (Usually Gene or Protein ID). This is usually the first column of your input Counts Matrix. Only columns of Text type from your input Counts Matrix will be available to select for this parameter. (Default: `NULL` - first column in the counts matrix will be used.)

param.name: sample_id_colname
param.label: Sample Names Column
param.help: The column from the sample metadata containing the sample names. The names in this column must exactly match the names used as the sample column names of your input Counts Matrix. (Default: `NULL` - first column in the sample metadata will be used.)

param.name: group_colname
param.label: Group Column
param.help: The column from the sample metadata containing the sample group information. This is usually a column showing to which experimental treatments each sample belongs (e.g. WildType, Knockout, Tumor, Normal, Before, After, etc.).

param.name: label_colname
param.label: Plot Labels Column
param.help: The column from the sample metadata containing the sample labels as you wish them to appear in the plots produced by this template. This can be the same Sample Names Column. However, you may desire different labels to display on your figure (e.g. shorter labels are sometimes preferred on plots). In that case, select the column with your preferred Labels here. The selected column should contain unique names for each sample. (Default: `NULL` -- `sample_id_colname` will be used.)

param.name: add_label
param.label: Add Labels
param.help: whether to add text labels for the points

param.name: label_font_size
param.label: Label Font Size
param.help: label font size for the PCA plot

param.name: color_values
param.label: Color Values
param.help: vector of colors as hex values or names recognized by R

param.name: interactive_plots
param.label: Interactive Plots
param.help: set to TRUE to make PCA and Histogram plots interactive with `plotly`, allowing you to hover your mouse over a point or line to view sample information. The similarity heat map will not display if this toggle is set to `TRUE`. Default is `FALSE`.

param.name: save_plots
param.label: Save Plots
param.help: Whether to save plots to files during analysis (Defaults to `TRUE`, overwritable using option 'moo_save_plots' or environment variable 'MOO_SAVE_PLOTS')

tool.help:
**PCA 2D**
Runs `MOSuite::plot_pca_2d()` - https://ccbr.github.io/MOSuite/reference/plot_pca_2d.html`
Perform and plot a 2D Principal Components Analysis
**Outputs:**
- figures: file (figures/pca/pca_2D.png)
